frameDefinitions: The Means action by which a deprofiled agent (the Protagonist) has attempted to achieve a Goal, is finished and the actual outcome of the Means action has been resolved, so that it either specifically matches the Protagonist's intent (e.g. success) or does not match it (e.g. failure).
Some Protection prevents a Danger from harming an Asset.

An individual or group, the Patrol moves through and examines a Ground in order to ensure that it is in a generally Desired_state_of_affairs, particularly that it is safe and contains no dangerous Unwanted_entity.

A Protagonist has become aware of a possible Danger (a dangerous event or a Dangerous_entity that might participate in an event harmful to the Protagonist) and is ready to engage in an Activity in response to that Danger.
A law enforcement Agency is tasked by a government with guaranteeing compliance with the laws in a particular Jurisdiction.
The Protagonist is in an initial state, before beginning to be involved in the Activity, but all pre-conditions for performance of the Activity have been satisfied.
frameExamples: The rubber on her sneakers <t>protected</t> her from the mud.
Detective Jones <t>patrolled</t> the northern half of the building.
All tropps are on high <t>alert</t> for possible intruders following an attack on a nearby compound.
listRoleDefinitions: The action that the agent undertakes to achieve the <fen>Goal</fen>.
The <fen>Goal</fen> is what the agent attempts to achieve by performing the <fen>Means</fen> action.
An entity directed by the agent as part of the <fen>Means</fen> action in order to accomplish the <fen>Goal</fen>.
A participant function of an <fen>Instrument</fen> or <fen>Means</fen> in a particular event or in events of a particular kind.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the attempt succeeds or fails
The place where <fen>Means</fen> action succeeds or fails.
The person, entity, or action that prevents harm to an <fen>Asset</fen>.
A situation that could damage the <fen>Asset</fen>.
Something desirable possessed by or directly associated with the <fen>Protection</fen> which might be lost or damaged.
The time when the <fen>Danger</fen> threatens.
The place where the <fen>Danger</fen> threatened the <fen>Asset</fen>.
The person (or group) who inspects the <fen>Ground</fen> to see that it is safe.
The area that the <fen>Patrol</fen> inspects with to ensure its safety.
An entity whose presence would impair the desirability or safety of the <fen>Ground</fen>.
The desired outcome of the patrolling. Normally this constituent is a PP Complement headed by <ment>for</ment>, or a <ment>to</ment>-marked VP Complement.
The desirable state of affairs which the <fen>Patrol</fen> hopes to ensure by visiting <fen>Ground</fen>.
>The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Patrol</fen> examines the <fen>Ground</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Protagonist</fen> who is prepared to undertake some action in response to a <fen>Danger</fen>.
The action that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is prepared to do.
A dangerous event or situation which teh <fen>Protagonist</fen> is aware of and is ready to respond to.
An entity of which the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is aware and which poses a danger.
The time when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is on alert to the potential Danger.
The <fen>Agency</fen> is a part of the government dedicated to enforcing the laws of the government's jurisdiction.
The <fen>Agency</fen> is charged with enforcing the laws of and within a particular <fen>Jurisdiction</fen>.
This role describes the general location where the <fen>Agency</fen> operates, but does not indicate the jurisdiction of the <fen>Agency</fen>.
This role identifies the <fen>Protagonist</fen> in the initial state of an activity.
The action that the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is prepared to do.
An entity which stands in metonymically for the <fen>Activity</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Protagonist</fen> is ready.
listRoleExamples: <fex>His daring, almost reckless, move</fex> succeeded and he lived to fight another day.

This move succeeded <fex>in securing trade concessions and the release of imprisoned
American sailors</fex>.
All of my usual source books seemed incomplete, but <fex>your website</fex> did the trick!
The machine was successful <fex>as a reconnaissance vehicle</fex>.
But it did the trick <fex>at the time</fex>.
A similar strategy, perhaps even bloodier, did the trick <fex>in El Salvador</fex>.
<fex>The tabloid's deal with the woman</fex> shielded Schwarzenegger.

Other nations tended to muffle or modulate their occasional annoyance with the
country that was their shield <fex>against the Soviet threat</fex>.
Almost 10 years later, that agreement insulated <fex>Microsoft</fex> from liability on copyright claims over the graphical user interface (GUI).
Regardless of the distribution media, USPTO information is safeguarded <fex>before, during, and after dissemination</fex> from improper access and modification.
To make his way on a foreign soil, he needed different guardians from those that protected him <fex>in his own birthplace</fex> .
<fex>Detective Jones</fex> patrolled the northern half of the building.
Four soldiers with submachine guns patrolled <fex>the room</fex>, and an officer made his rounds at frequent intervals.
Security guards patrolled <fex>for intruders</fex> while the game was in progress.
Patrol all unlit areas <fex>to ensure no one is hiding there</fex>.
All our grounds are regularly patrolled <fex>for safety</fex>.
Officerspoliced the parade grounds <fex>during the Memorial day events.</fex> .
<fex>Troops</fex> are on high alert following a string of bombings downtown.
You should be on alert <fex>to evacuate within 30 minutes of hearing the siren</fex> .
We were all on guard <fex>for possible attempts to sabotage the operation</fex>.
Be on alert <fex>for tigers</fex>.
They're on alert <fex>now</fex> .
The students were finally ready <fex>to take the exam</fex> .
Are you ready <fex>for a baby</fex> ?
He looks like he 's ready <fex>now</fex> .

passageCandidateSpans.text: ICD-11 for Mortality and Morbidity Statistics
